DOCNAME: CASE OF LIDIA NOWAK v. POLAND
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant divorced .
CARDINAL . On DATE she lodged with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) a claim for division of matrimonial property consisting of a family house in GPE and a right to a flat in a housing - co - operative in GPE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings , CARDINAL of which were adjourned and CARDINAL expert report was obtained .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court issued an interim order ( zarządzenie tymczasowe ) securing the applicant ’s claim . On DATE the defendant appealed against the making of the order . On DATE the court amended its order .
CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE the ORG gave a preliminary decision ( postanowienie wstępne ) on the parties’ respective shares in the matrimonial property .
CARDINAL . The applicant and the defendant appealed on DATE and DATE , respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) amended the preliminary decision and dismissed the defendant ’s appeal . His cassation appeal was rejected on DATE on procedural grounds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered that an expert report be obtained . The report was submitted on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered that the third expert report be obtained .
CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE the applicant ’s lawyer made a friendly - settlement proposal . The court stayed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings and delivered a partial decision ( postanowienie częściowe ) in the case , concerning the composition of the matrimonial property . The defendant appealed against this decision . On DATE ORG rejected the defendant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a complaint under LAW on DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) .

CARDINAL . She sought a ruling declaring that the length of the proceedings before ORG had been excessive and an award of just satisfaction in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) ( approx . CARDINAL ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed her complaintin the part alleging . , to ORG . The court observed that the proceedings had indeed been lengthy but it was the applicant ’s husband who had been responsible for the delay in examination of the case . The court categorically stated that ORG was not responsible for the protracted length of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII .
